Description: Rim and body fragment of South Ionian pottery plate; exterior unslipped, with three bands; interior, cream slip: dots between bands at rim; metopal zone of alternating tongues and dotted squares; traces of tondo decoration; red on alternate tongues.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IId pl. IV, 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.721)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
